  • Uses of TextFunction in put.text_transformer.functions

    Classes in put.text_transformer.functions that implement TextFunction
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    class 
    BaseTextFunction
    A basic implementation of the TextFunction interface that returns the input text unchanged.
    class 
    CapitalizeDecorator
    A decorator class that capitalizes the first letter of each word in the input text, while converting the rest of the letters to lowercase.
    class 
    ConvertAcronymDecorator
    A decorator class that converts commonly used phrases in the input text to their corresponding acronyms or abbreviations.
    class 
    DeduplicateDecorator
    A decorator class that removes consecutive duplicate words from the input text.
    class 
    ExpandAcronymDecorator
    A decorator class that expands acronyms in the input text into their full phrase equivalents.
    class 
    LatexDecorator
    A decorator class that escapes special LaTeX characters in the input text.
    class 
    LowerCaseDecorator
    A decorator class that converts all characters in the input text to lowercase.
    class 
    NumberToWordsDecorator
    A decorator class that converts numeric values in the input text into their corresponding English words representation.
    class 
    ReverseDecorator
    A decorator class that reverses the input text while preserving the case of characters based on their original positions.
    class 
    TextFunctionDecorator
    An abstract base class for all text transformation decorators.
    class 
    UpperCaseDecorator
    A decorator that converts the result of a TextFunction to uppercase.
    Fields in put.text_transformer.functions declared as TextFunction
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected TextFunction
    TextFunctionDecorator.wrappedFunction
    The wrapped TextFunction instance to which this decorator delegates.
